#summary Declaration of interfaces.
<wiki:toc max_depth="3"/>

= Interface declaration =
The syntax to declare an interface is specified by:
<blockquote><em>
interface-declaration:
    annotations<sub>opt</sub> interface-modifiers<sub>opt</sub> <tt>interface</tt> identifier type-parameter-list<sub>opt</sub> interface-base<sub>opt</sub><br/>
        type-parameter-constraints-clauses<sub>opt</sub> interface-body ;<sub>opt</sub>
</em></blockquote>

= Interface modifiers =
The interface modifiers in Stab have the same usage and semantic as the interface modifiers in Java.
<blockquote><em>
interface-modifiers:
    interface-modifier<br/>
    interface-modifiers interface-modifier
interface-modifier:
    <b>One of</b> <tt>public protected private</tt>
</em></blockquote>

= Interface base specification =
The interface base specification is a list of implemented interfaces.
<blockquote><em>
interface-base:
    : type-list
type-list:
    class-type<br/>
    type-list , class-type
</em></blockquote>

= Interface body =
The interface body is the place where the members of an interface are declared. Only methods, properties, and indexer can be declared.
<blockquote><em>
interface-body:
    { interface-member-declarations<sub>opt</sub> }
interface-member-declarations:
    interface-member-declaration<br/>
    interface-member-declarations interface-member-declaration
interface-member-declaration:
    interface-method-declaration<br/>
    interface-property-declaration<br/>
    interface-indexer-declaration
</em></blockquote>
